thread.title: Man left with head injuries after being attacked at Bondi Beach
thread.title_full: Man left with head injuries after being attacked at Bondi Beach

author: Georgina Mitchell
title: Man left with head injuries after being attacked at Bondi Beach
text:
Man left with head injuries after being attacked at Bondi Beach Georgina Mitchell twitter TWEET More 
A man has been taken to hospital after he was attacked by a group of men at Bondi Beach on Thursday afternoon, leaving him with head injuries. 
Emergency services were called to a grassed area at the beach at 1.10pm after multiple people witnessed the man being hit by weapons. SHARE Link Beachgoers hold a towel to the head of a man who was attacked at Bondi on Thursday. Photo: Ten News 
It is understood the man was sitting nearby when he was assaulted, before he managed to break away and run. 
The area was packed with people at the time, with a large number of witnesses giving differing descriptions of the weapons used in the attack. SHARE It is understood the man's condition is not life-threatening. Photo: MEGA 
Some reported seeing poles, while others said they saw a metal bar or a baseball bat with nails sticking out of it. 
Mark Owen told Ten Eyewitness News the group of men used large, round solid pieces of wood in the "brutal" attack. Advertisement 
"And then at the end of it, they were like nails," he said. 
Chris O'Neil, who was selling ice cream at the beach, said he saw "some guy beating this other guy with something". He rushed to offer first aid to the injured man. 
"I don't know if it was a metal pole or a wooden, or whatever, but then the guy managed to get away and he ran down here very quick and he fell over," Mr O'Neil said. 
"Above his eye his head was completely split open up the side. It didn't look good at all." 
Witnesses said the group then jumped into a white car and sped away. 
The 34-year-old man suffered head injuries and was taken to St Vincent's Hospital in a stable condition. 
Photographs shortly after the attack show the man, who appears to be dazed, lying on the ground as beach-goers and lifeguards apply pressure to his head wounds with a towel. 
Police were quickly on the scene. They remained tight-lipped about the exact details of the incident on Thursday afternoon, as they hunted for the perpetrators. 
A section of the grass and footpath near where the man was attacked remained taped off as a crime scene several hours later, as uniformed police from the eastern suburbs took photographs and spoke to witnesses. 
The man was in a stable condition on Thursday afternoon. It is understood his injuries are not life-threatening. 
In a statement, NSW Police said a crime scene has been established following "an altercation between a number of people at Bondi Beach". 
"Shortly after 1pm a man suffered injuries after he was assaulted by a group of men," the statement said. 
"No further information is available at this time. 
"Anyone who may have witnessed the incident, or have information that could assist, should contact officers at Eastern Suburbs Local Area Command." Advertisement
